db:abstract.db:para: Provides a generic way of loading various 3D assets format into a Qt3D scene.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: It should be noted that Assimp aiString is explicitly defined to be UTF-8.

db:section.db:title: AssimpParser::AssimpParser()
db:section.db:para: Constructor. Initializes a new instance of AssimpParser.

db:section.db:title: [virtual noexcept] AssimpParser::~AssimpParser()
db:section.db:para: Destructor. Cleans the parser properly before destroying it.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] bool AssimpParser::isExtensionSupported(const QUrl &source) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the extension of source is supported by the assimp parser.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] Qt3DCore::QEntity *AssimpParser::node(const QString &id)
db:section.db:para: Returns a Node from the scene identified by id. Returns Q_NULLPTR if the node was not found.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] Qt3DCore::QEntity *AssimpParser::scene(const QString &id = QString())
db:section.db:para: Returns a Entity node which is the root node of the scene node specified by id. If id is empty, the scene is assumed to be the root node of the scene.
Returns Q_NULLPTR if id was specified but no node matching it was found.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] void AssimpParser::setSource(const QUrl &source)
db:section.db:para: Sets the source used by the parser to load the asset file. If the file is valid, this will trigger parsing of the file.
